definition: fat/fertile/loose-fitting or large/to fertilize/to become rich by illegal means/fertilizer/manure
Zhuang ethnic group of Guangxi, the PRC's second most numerous ethnic group

sentences.english: A hungry lion sat watching a fat bull feeding in a field.
sentences.chinese: 飢餓的獅子坐着看肥壯的公牛在地裏喫草。

sentences.english: Their prosperity and their fatness mean the impoverishment of the country.
sentences.chinese: 它們的興盛和肥壯正是地方的貧瘠。

sentences.english: These animals rarely thrive in captivity.
sentences.chinese: 這些動物欄養起來很少會肥壯。

sentences.english: Ye eat the fat, and ye clothe you with the wool, ye kill them that are fed: but ye feed not the flock.
sentences.chinese: 你們喫脂油，穿羊毛，宰肥壯的，卻不牧養羣羊。

definition: Jiguan district of Jixi city 雞西|鸡西[Ji1 xi1], Heilongjiang
the spongy, white pulp inside the stem of rush plants, used as a wick for oil lamps
(bird species of China) common pheasant (Phasianus colchicus)
to polish a text/rhetoric/ornate language/to use florid language to conceal errors/to gloss over
clear as ice and clean as jade (idiom); spotless/irreproachable/incorruptible
